steps.description: Coat -Coat a 6-oz. ramekin cup with cooking spray
Pour-Pour 1 egg into the ramekin cup
Microwave-Microwave the ramekin cup uncovered on high for 30 seconds
Cut -Cut the English muffin into two pieces with a knife
stir-stir the ramekin cup
Microwave -Continue to Microwave for 15-30 more seconds or until the egg is almost set
Top -Top cup with 1 tablespoon of salsa
sprinkle -sprinkle 1 tablespoon of cheese on cup
Microwave -Microwave just until cheese melts, about 10 seconds
Line -Line the bottom piece of the English muffin with lettuce
Place -Place the egg from the cup over the lettuce
replace -replace the top of the English muffin
Peel-Peel 1 garlic clove
Cut-Cut 1/8 garlic clove
Mince-Mince 1/8 garlic clove
Mix-Mix 1/4 cup sweet-and-sour sauce and 1/2 teaspoon soy sauce in a small bowl
Peel-Peel one medium onion
Place-Place 5 meatballs in a Microwave-safe plate
cut-Cut onion into two pieces
Cut-Cut 1/4 medium carrot into short, thin strips
Slice-Slice 1/8 medium onion
Top-Top the plate with the carrots, onion, garlic and 1/4 tsp pepper powder
Pour-Pour the sauces over the meatballs
Microwave-Microwave the plate, covered, on high for 1.5 minutes
Stir-Stir the contents in the microwave with a spoon
Microwave-Microwave the plate, covered, on high for 1.5 minutes
Stir-Stir the contents in the microwave with a spoon
Microwave-Microwave for 1 more minute
Take-Take a microwavable mug
add-Measure 1/16 teaspoon of baking soda and add it to the mug
add-Measure 1/8 teaspoon of salt and add it to the mug
add-Measure 1/8 teaspoon of baking powder and add it to the mug
add-Measure 4 tablespoons of flour and add it to the mug
Stir-Stir the contents in the mug well
Add-Add in 3 tablespoons of milk to the mug
Add-1 tablespoon of olive oil to the mug
Mix-Mix the contents of the mug thoroughly. (There might be some lumps, but that is ok.)
Take-Take 1 tablespoon of marinara sauce
spread-spread marinara sauce around the surface of the batter
Sprinkle-Sprinkle 1 generous tablespoon of mozzarella cheese on top of the sauce
Sprinkle-Sprinkle dried Italian herbs inside the mug
Microwave-Microwave for 1 minute 20 seconds, or until it rises and the toppings are bubbling
Peel-Peel 1 garlic clove
Chop-Chop 1 garlic clove on a cutting board
Remove-Remove the noodles from the package(Break Noodles / Keep them as a block)
Peel-Peel 1 medium onion
slice-slice 1/4 medium onion into pieces
Put-Put all the Vegetables in a microwave-safe bowl
Add-Add the noodles to the bowl
cover-cover the noodles with water
Cover-Cover with a lid (or paper towel) to prevent splattering
Microwave-Microwave the ramen for 4 minutes
Add-Add basil to the bowl
Let-Let the noodles sit for about 1 minute after the microwave stops
Add-Add chopped cilantro to the bowl
Mix-Mix in the flavour packet to the bowl
Stir-Stir noodles with a spoon or fork until the flavouring dissolves
Measure-Measure 12 ounces of cold water
Place-Place the dripper on top of a coffee mug
Weigh-Weigh the coffee beans (0.8oz-0.12 oz)
Grind-Grind the coffee beans until the coffee grounds are the consistency of coarse sand, about 20 seconds
Prepare-Prepare the filter insert by folding the paper filter in half to create a semi-circle, and in half again to create a quarter-circle
transfer-transfer water to a kettle
Place-Place the paper filter in the dripper
Boil-Boil the water. (While the water is boiling, assemble the filter cone)
spread-spread open filter in dripper to create a cone

check-Once the water has boiled, check the temperature of the water. (The water should be between 195-205 degrees Fahrenheit or between 91-96 degrees Celsius. If the water is too hot, let it cool briefly.)
Transfer-Transfer the grounds to the filter cone
Pour-Pour a small amount of water into the filter to wet the grounds
Wait-Wait about 30 seconds for the coffee to bloom. (You will see small bubbles or foam on the coffee grounds during this step.)
pour-Slowly pour the rest of the water over the grounds in a circular motion. Do not overfill beyond the top of the paper filter
drain-Let the coffee drain completely into the mug before removing the dripper
Discard-Discard the paper filter and coffee grounds
add-Extract and add contents of an egg to a microwave-safe bowl
Whisk-Whisk the egg
Place-Place 8 inch tortilla on a cutting board
Microwave-Microwave for 3 minutes, stirring in between
Add-Add 1/2 tbsp sweet and sour sauce to the bowl
Sprinkle-Sprinkle oregano in the bowl
Add-Add 1 tbsp salsa to the bowl
Mix-Mix the contents of the bowl well
Pour-Pour egg mixture on top of the tortilla
Sprinkle-Sprinkle 1 tbsp shredded cheddar cheese on top of the egg
Roll-Roll the tortilla from one end to another into a log shape, about 1.5 inches thick. Roll it tight enough to prevent gaps but not so tight that the filling leaks
Fill-Fill a microwave-safe mug with skimmed milk
Microwave-Microwave the contents of the mug for 1 minute
Add-Add 2 pieces of chocolate to the mug
Add-Add 1/5 teaspoon cinnamon to the mug
Add-Add 1 teaspoon of white sugar to the mug
Mix-Mix the contents of the mug
Heat-Heat the contents of the mug for 1 minute and serve
Cut or tear-Cut or tear 1 slices of bread into bite-size pieces
melt-In a large mug, melt 1 tablespoon of softened butter in the microwave for about 30 seconds
Roll-Roll the butter around in the mug to coat it
whisk-In the mug, whisk one egg with a fork until well blended
Sprinkle-Sprinkle 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon over the egg
Add-Add 1/4 teaspoon vanilla extract to the mug
stir-stir the mug
add-add bread pieces to the egg mixture in the mug, pressing the bread down into the egg
Microwave-Microwave on high for 90 seconds until the egg is cooked through
Put-Put the mug's contents on a plate
cut-cut the contents on plate, and serve
Place-Place 8-inch flour tortilla on cutting board
scoop-Use a butter knife to scoop nut butter from the jar
Spread-Spread nut butter onto the tortilla, leaving 1/2-inch uncovered at the edges
Clean-Clean the knife by wiping it with a paper towel
scoop-Use the knife to scoop jelly from the jar
Spread-Spread jelly over the nut butter
Clean-Clean the knife by wiping with a paper towel
Roll-Roll the tortilla from one end to the other into a log shape, about 1.5 inches thick. Roll it tight enough to prevent gaps, but not so tight that the filling leaks
Secure-Secure the rolled tortilla by inserting 5 toothpicks about 1 inch apart
Trim-Trim the ends of the tortilla roll with the butter knife, leaving 1/2 inch margin between the last toothpick and the end of the roll
Discard-Discard ends of the tortilla
Slide-Slide floss under the tortilla, perpendicular to the length of the roll
Place-Place the floss halfway between toothpicks
Cross-Cross the floss's two ends over the tortilla roll's top
pull-pull the floss ends in opposite directions to slice
slicing-Continue slicing with floss to create 1 more pinwheel
slicing-Continue slicing with floss to create 1 more pinwheel
slicing-Continue slicing with floss to create 1 more pinwheel
Place-Place the pinwheels on a plate
Rinse-Rinse a tomato
dry-gently dry it with a paper/tea towel
Slice-Slice one tomato into about 1/2 inch thick slices
Place-Place the thick slices of tomatoes on a platter, ensuring they only make a single layer
Sprinkle-Sprinkle mozzarella cheese on top of the tomato throughout the platter
Season-Season the tomato slices with salt
Season-Season platter with 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
Garnish-Garnish platter with italian seasoning
Add-Add a drizzle of extra-virgin olive oil, about 1 tablespoon, over the entire platter
Measure-Measure 2 cups of frozen corn
Thaw-Thaw the frozen corn by putting it in a sieve and running it under cold water
Add-Add the corn into a microwave-safe bowl
Microwave-Microwave the corn for 2 minutes
Add-Add 1 teaspoon of softened butter
Add-1 teaspoon of pepper powder to the bowl
stir-then stir the bowl
Microwave-Microwave the corn for 3 more minutes
Extract-Extract lime juice from 1/3 lime
Add-Add 1 teaspoon salt to the bowl
add-add lime juice to the bowl
Mix-Mix the contents of the bowl well
Peel-Peel 4 large garlic cloves
mince-mince the garlic
Take-Take 1 tomato
Chop-Chop tomato roughly (anysize chunks are fine)
puree-puree tomatoes without any water in a blender/mixer
Heat-Heat 3 tbsp oil in a pan over medium heat
Add-1/2 tsp cumin seeds to the pan
Add-Add 1/4 tsp mustard to the pan
add-When mustard and cumin seeds begin to sizzle, add minced garlic
Lower-Lower the heat
Saute-Saute the garlic for 2-3 minutes
Add-Add 2 tbsp red chili powder to the pan
mix-mix well contents of the pan
Add-Add tomato puree to the pan
Add-1/2 tsp salt to the pan
Mix-Mix well tomato puree with contents in the pan
simmer-Allow the mixture to simmer over low heat for 5 minutes or until the mixture becomes thick
Take-Take the pan off the heat
Transfer-Transfer it to a serving bowl
Chop-Chop 1/4 medium onion
Chop-Chop 1 tsp cilantro
Chop-Chop 1/4 tomato
Chop-Chop 1 green chilli
Peel-Peel 2 garlic cloves
Mince-Mince peeled garlic cloves
Crack-Crack one egg in the bowl
add-add 1 tbsp milk to the bowl
add-add 1/3 tsp salt to the bowl
Whisk-Whisk the egg mixture in the bowl
Heat-Heat 2 tbsp oil in a heavy-bottomed or nonstick pan on medium heat
add-add 1/3 tsp salt to the pan
add-add chopped onions to the pan
Saute-Saute the onions on medium heat until they are soft and translucent
Add-Add garlic to the pan
Add-Add chilli to the pan
Cook-Cook for 1 minute, mixing everything
Add-Add 1/8 tsp of turmeric to the pan
Add-Add tomatoes to the pan
Cook-Cook covered for 1 minute or until the tomatoes soften
pour-Slowly pour the whisked eggs into the pan
mixing-Keep mixing with a spatula for 3 minutes or until the eggs are almost cooked
Garnish-Garnish with 1 tbsp chopped cilantro and serve
whisk-In a mixing bowl, whisk 1 cup of chilled curd until smooth. Use fresh homemade or packaged curd
Add-1/4 teaspoon of red chilli powder to the bowl
Rinse-Rinse 1 medium sized cucumber
Add-1/2 teaspoon of chaat masala powder to the bowl
peel-peel the cucumber
Add-Add 1 teaspoon of cumin powder to the bowl
chop or grate-chop or grate the cucumber
add-add 1 tablespoon of chopped cilantro leaves to the bowl
Add-1/4 teaspoon salt to the bowl
Add-Add the chopped or grated cucumber to the whisked curd
Combine-Combine all the ingredients in the bowl
Spiralize-Spiralize 1 medium zucchini into thin noodles using a spiralizer
Peel-Peel 1 garlic cloves
Heat-Heat a large pan on medium heat
Melt-Melt 1 tablespoons of softened butter
Add-Add 1 large minced garlic cloves to the pan
Cook-Cook garlic until fragrant (about 1 minutes). Be careful not to burn garlic
Add-Add the zucchini noodles
Add-1/6 cup grated parmesan cheese
season-season with salt
season-pepper to taste
Cook-Cook for 2 minutes or until the zoodles are done
Remove-Remove from heat
Top-Top with more parmesan if desired
Rinse-Rinse 3 mushrooms under cold water
Peel-Peel 2 garlic cloves
Chop-Chop 1 shallot
pat-pat rinsed mushrooms dry with a paper towel
Pull-Pull out mushroom stems
Slice-Slice the mushrooms
mince-mince garlic cloves
Heat-Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat
add-Once the pan is hot, add the mushrooms
cook-cook for 3-5 minutes, stirring often, until mushrooms start to soften and brown
Add-Add chopped shallot to the pan
cook-cook the pan, often stirring, for 1 minute
Add-Add 2 cloves of minced garlic to the pan
Add-1/4 tbsp balsamic vinegar to the pan
cook-cook the pan, often stirring, for 1 minute
Season-pepper on pan to taste
Season-Season pan with salt
Transfer-Transfer the contents of the pan to a serving dish
Add-1 egg to a blender
Add-Add 1 banana to a blender
Add-1 heaped tbsp flour to a blender
Add-1/2 tsp baking powder to a blender
blitz-blitz the blender for 20 seconds
Melt-Melt a small knob of butter in a non-stick frying pan over low-medium heat
Pour-Pour three little puddles straight from the blender into the frying pan
Cook-Cook for 1 min or until the tops start to bubble
Flip-Flip the pancakes with a fork or a fish slice spatula
Chop-Chop 1 strawberry
cook-cook for 20-30 seconds more
Transfer-Transfer to a plate
Serve-Serve the pancakes with chopped strawberries
splash-splash maple syrup on plate
crack-crack one egg in a bowl
Chop-Chop 2 tbsp cilantro
Take-Take a tomato
Cut-Cut tomato into two pieces
add-add the chopped cilantro to the bowl
add-1/2 tsp ground black pepper to the bowl
Beat-Beat the contents of the bowl
Heat-Heat 1 tbsp oil in a non-stick frying pan
cook-cook the tomatoes cut-side down until they start to soften and colour
Scoop-Scoop the tomatoes from the pan
put-put tomatoes on a serving plate
Pour-Pour the egg mixture into the pan
stir-stir gently with a wooden spoon so the egg that sets on the base of the pan moves to enable the uncooked egg to flow into the space
Stop-Stop stirring when it's nearly cooked to allow it to set into an omelette
Transfer-Transfer omelette to the plate and serve with the tomatoes
Take-Take 5 in number broccoli florets
Add-Add 1/8 teaspoon black pepper to the bowl
Add-Add 1/8 cup soy sauce to the bowl
Take-Take 2 cremini mushrooms
Add-Add 1/6 cup water the bowl
Add-Add 1 teaspoon cornstarch to the bowl
Peel-Peel 2 cloves of garlic
Add-Add 1/2 tablespoon minced ginger to the bowl
mince-mince garlic
Take-Take 1 bell pepper
Add-Add 2 cloves minced garlic to the bowl
slice-slice mushrooms
Add-Add 1 tablespoon honey to the bowl
Whisk-Whisk the contents of bowl
Set-Set aside the sauce mixture
slice-slice 1/3 of the bell pepper
Heat-Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat
Add-add sliced mushrooms to the skillet
Add-Add broccoli to the skillet
cook-cook, stirring often, for 4 minutes. If the pan gets too hot on medium-high, turn the heat down to medium
Add-Add bell pepper to the skillet
continue cooking-continue cooking, stirring often, for 2-3 minutes, until vegetables are crisp-tender
Whisk-Whisk the sauce again to recombine the ingredients
Pour-Pour the sauce into the skillet
cook-cook, stirring, for 1 minute until the sauce thickens
Cut-Cut 1/4 block or 3 ounces of fresh tofu into large cubes (about 1 in x 1 in)
pat-pat tofu dry with a towel
Add-Add 1 tablespoon of olive oil to a non-stick pan
add-add the tofu cubes to the pan
add-add 1/4 tsp salt to the pan
Turn-Turn on the heat to medium
Cook-Cook 5 to 6 minutes until tofu cubes are lightly browned on the bottom
remove-Briefly remove the pan from the heat to reduce spitting
Flip-Flip the tofu with tongs
Return-Return the heat to medium
cook-cook until tofu turns brown
remove-Briefly remove from the heat again
drizzle-drizzle 1 tablespoon soy sauce (watch for spitting) on the pan
drizzle-drizzle with the 1 tablespoons sesame oil on the pan
Return-Return to low heat
cook-cook pan for 2 minutes
flip-flip tofu on the pan
cook-cook pan for 2 minutes until the colour is darkened
Transfer-Transfer to a serving dish
Measure and add-1/4 tsp baking powder to the bowl
Place-Place the paper cupcake liner inside the mug
Measure and add-a pinch of salt to the mixing bowl
Measure and add-1.5 tbsp sugar to the mixing bowl
Set-Set aside the lined mug
Measure and add-Measure and add 2 tbsp flour to the mixing bowl
Whisk-Whisk to combine mixture of flour, sugar and baking powder in the bowl
Measure and add-2 tbsp water to the bowl
Measure and add-1/4 tsp vanilla extract to the bowl
Measure and add-Measure and add 2 tsp vegetable oil to the bowl
Whisk-Whisk batter until no lumps remain
Pour-Pour batter into prepared mug

Microwave-Microwave the mug and batter on high power for 60 seconds. Check if the cake is done by inserting and toothpick into the center of the cake and then removing it. If wet batter clings to the toothpick, microwave for an additional 5 seconds. If the toothpick comes out clean, continue
Invert-Invert the mug to release the cake onto a plate
Allow-Allow to cool until it is no longer hot to the touch
remove-then carefully remove the paper liner
Scoop-While the cake is cooling, prepare to pipe the frosting. Scoop 4 spoonfuls of chocolate frosting into a zip-top bag
seal-seal zip top bag, removing as much air as possible
cut-Use scissors to cut one corner from the bag to create a small opening 1/4 inch in diameter
Squeeze-Squeeze the frosting through the opening to apply small dollops of frosting to the plate in a circle around the base of the cake
Add-Add 1 tablespoons of water to the bowl
Add-Add 1/3 cup cheddar cheese to a microwave-safe cup
Chop-Chop 1/4 red bell pepper into tiny bits
Melt-Melt the cheese by microwaving cup for 30 sec. (Check after 30 seconds and microwave for 10 seconds more if needed)
Place-Place the chopped pepper in the microwave-safe bowl
Microwave-Microwave the bowl, covered, for 2 minutes
Mix-Mix the cheese and red bell pepper in the bowl
Add-Add 1/4 teaspoon salt to the bowl
add-add 1/2 tbsp softened butter to the bowl
Add-Add 1/4 teaspoon pepper to the bowl
Mix-Mix all the ingredients of the bowl well
Take-Take 1 ripe avocado
Open-Open a can of tuna
drain-drain excess water from can
Lay-Lay out 2 large lettuce leaves
cut-cut avocado into thin slices
Add-1/4 cup mayonnaise to the bowl
Chop-Chop 1 scallion
place-place avocado slices on each leaf
Add-1 tsp Sriracha sauce to the bowl
Add-add chopped scallion to the bowl
Add-Add 1 can drained tuna to the bowl
Mix-Mix the contents of the bowl
Season-Season bowl with 1/4 tsp salt
Season-season 1/4 tsp pepper on the bowl
top-top lettuce leaves with the tuna mixture
Roll-Roll up the lettuce wraps
secure-secure the wrap with a toothpick
add-1/4 tsp salt to a bowl
Slice-Slice two 1/2 inch thick rounds from a baguette (slice slanted)
add-1/16 cup basil to a bowl
add-1/8 cup shredded mozzarella to a bowl
Brush-Brush 2 slices of baguette with olive oil on both sides
add-1/4 tsp pepper to a bowl
Cut-Cut 1/4 cup of cherry tomatoes into halves
add-In a bowl, add the cut cherry tomatoes
Toast-Toast both sides of the slices on the pan for 2 to 3 minutes until lightly charred and crispy and transfer the slices to a plate
Combine-Combine the contents of the bowl
Spoon-Spoon the mixture from the bowl onto the bread
